@mihirpat1, After this change we now have sonic-mgmt test failures occurring.

.../platform_tests/api/test_sfp.py::TestSfpApi::test_get_transceiver_info
.../platform_tests/api/test_sfp.py::TestSfpApi::test_get_transceiver_threshold_info
 
if info_dict["type_abbrv_name"] in ["QSFP-DD", "OSFP-8X"]:
    expected_keys += self.QSFPDD_EXPECTED_XCVR_THRESHOLD_INFO_KEYS
E   KeyError: 'media_interface_code'
E   KeyError: 'host_lane_assignment_option'
E   KeyError: 'host_electrical_interface'
E   KeyError: 'media_lane_assignment_option',

These tests need to be modified to account for above changes (field removals).

> @mihirpat1, After this change we now have sonic-mgmt test failures occurring.
> 
> .../platform_tests/api/test_sfp.py::TestSfpApi::test_get_transceiver_info .../platform_tests/api/test_sfp.py::TestSfpApi::test_get_transceiver_threshold_info
> 
> if info_dict["type_abbrv_name"] in ["QSFP-DD", "OSFP-8X"]: expected_keys += self.QSFPDD_EXPECTED_XCVR_THRESHOLD_INFO_KEYS E KeyError: 'media_interface_code' E KeyError: 'host_lane_assignment_option' E KeyError: 'host_electrical_interface' E KeyError: 'media_lane_assignment_option',
> 
> These tests need to be modified to account for above changes (field removals).

@snider-nokia Sure, we will fix this testcase.

Hello @mihirpat1 , there's still remaining failure that is caused by this PR, can you please also address that? Thanks

```
platform_tests/api/test_sfp.py:906: 
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 

self = <tests.platform_tests.api.test_sfp.TestSfpApi object at 0x7fb4bf45f370>
xcvr_info_dict = {'active_apsel_hostlane1': 1, 'active_apsel_hostlane2': 1, 'active_apsel_hostlane3': 1, 'active_apsel_hostlane4': 1, ...}

    def is_xcvr_support_lpmode(self, xcvr_info_dict):
        """Returns True if transceiver is support low power mode, False if not supported"""
        xcvr_type = xcvr_info_dict["type"]
        ext_identifier = xcvr_info_dict["ext_identifier"]
        if ("QSFP" not in xcvr_type and "OSFP" not in xcvr_type) or "Power Class 1" in ext_identifier:
            return False
    
        # Temporarily add this logic to skip lpmode test for some transceivers with known issue
        for xcvr_to_skip in self.LPMODE_SKIP_LIST:
            if (xcvr_info_dict["manufacturer"].strip() == xcvr_to_skip["manufacturer"] and
>                   xcvr_info_dict["host_electrical_interface"].strip() == xcvr_to_skip["host_electrical_interface"]):
E                   KeyError: 'host_electrical_interface'
```

I opened https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/issues/20597 to track this issue

> @jianyuewu Where are we clearing the cache?

No need explicitly clear the cache, as it will clear automatically when Xcvrd restart.

@mihirpat1 are you OK to approve and merge this PR?
@jianyuewu i added also 202411 as i beleive this is needed to any system supports cmis host management. if you dont think please remove the label

> > @jianyuewu Where are we clearing the cache?
> 
> No need explicitly clear the cache, as it will clear automatically when Xcvrd restart.

@jianyuewu In case of SFP removal, shouldn't we delete the cache to ensure that the transceiver specific information is deleted?

> > > @jianyuewu Where are we clearing the cache?
> > 
> > 
> > No need explicitly clear the cache, as it will clear automatically when Xcvrd restart.
> 
> @jianyuewu In case of SFP removal, shouldn't we delete the cache to ensure that the transceiver specific information is deleted?

Just confirmed in the code, and realize that though when SFP removal, cache is still there, but when SFP plug in, new instance will be created. We always get back a brand-new CmisApi instance. Because our per-method caching is purely instance-based, 
so it will use new cache instead when SFP plug in.
in class SfpBase:
def __init__(self):
        # List of ThermalBase-derived objects representing all thermals
        # available on the SFP
        self._thermal_list = []
        self._xcvr_api_factory = XcvrApiFactory(self.read_eeprom, self.write_eeprom)
        self._xcvr_api = None
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9f63cd60-f4d2-4141-bd70-65651705f5a6)

Hi @prgeor , I think other vendor should reinitialize api object on OIR, or it will run into a problem when user plug out a CMIS module and replace with a SFF8636 module. (This is possible with some module adapter)
OK, if some platform is not compatible, I'll update the code, to clear the cache in reset_module(), when module removal event happen.
/azp run
Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).
@prgeor @mihirpat1 Now I added to reset_module() API, it will clear the cache when reset_module(), when plug out.

@prgeor @Junchao-Mellanox can we have a meeting in US PDT 17:00pm/China CST 8:00am time? We can discuss further about if we need cmis cache enable flag or not use it. Thank you~
If need enable cache from platform repo, maybe can have a try like this, but looks complicated, not so sure if any other negative impact, like introduce dependency, mlnx-platform-api depends on sonic-platform-common:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c55c9ca2-5f6c-450b-ba92-e5db6887b5b9)
sonic-buildimage\platform\mellanox\mlnx-platform-api\sonic_platform\platform.py
```python
try:
    # import
    from sonic_platform_base.sonic_xcvr.api.public.cmis import CmisApi
...
class Platform(PlatformBase):
    def __init__(self):
        PlatformBase.__init__(self)
        # enable cache
        CmisApi.set_cache_enabled(True)
        if DeviceDataManager.get_linecard_count() == 0:
            self._chassis = Chassis()
        else:
            self._chassis = ModularChassis()
```
sonic-buildimage\src\sonic-platform-common\sonic_platform_base\sonic_xcvr\api\public\cmis.py
```python
class CmisApi(XcvrApi):
    ...
    cache_enabled = False

    @classmethod
    def set_cache_enabled(cls, enabled: bool):
        """
        Set the cache_enabled flag to control read_only_cached_api_return behavior.
        """
        cls.cache_enabled = bool(enabled)
```

> @jianyuewu @prgeor @Junchao-Mellanox Post issuing `sfputil reset EthernetXX`, the cache will not be cleared. Wondering if we should handle this case so that xcvrd can indeed read data from hardware post transceiver reset rather than reading data from the cache? Asking since the user could have issued reset since some fields in EEPROM were not accessible initially.

In this scenario, there will be race condition, not sure how to protect it currently, maybe need some lock.

> > @jianyuewu @prgeor @Junchao-Mellanox Post issuing `sfputil reset EthernetXX`, the cache will not be cleared. Wondering if we should handle this case so that xcvrd can indeed read data from hardware post transceiver reset rather than reading data from the cache? Asking since the user could have issued reset since some fields in EEPROM were not accessible initially.
> 
> In this scenario, there will be race condition, not sure how to protect it currently, maybe need some lock.

Hi @prgeor @mihirpat1 Assume if EEPROM data is not changed, then sfp reset is fine, because cache data is still valid. Because we only cache the value in SFP which won't change, for mutable data like status, we didn't put in cache, so no problem in sfp reset.

> @jianyuewu @prgeor @Junchao-Mellanox Post issuing `sfputil reset EthernetXX`, the cache will not be cleared. Wondering if we should handle this case so that xcvrd can indeed read data from hardware post transceiver reset rather than reading data from the cache? Asking since the user could have issued reset since some fields in EEPROM were not accessible initially.

Hi @prgeor @mihirpat1 Assume if EEPROM data is not changed, then sfp reset is fine, because cache data is still valid. Because we only cache the value in SFP which won't change, for mutable data like status, we didn't put in cache, so no problem in sfp reset.
/azp run
Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).

Some problematic cable scenarios:
If user could have issued reset since some fields in EEPROM were not accessible initially (the cable has some problem in this case, after re-plugin, then data will be correct.) In this case, with cache enabled, there is a WA: we can reset the sfp by **xcvrd restart**, then data will be correct.
/azp run

@mihirpat1 this PR removes several alarm flags, trying to understand if they are renamed  or completed removed? E.g. where did `osnrhighalarm_flag`, `esnrlowalarm_flag`, `rxsigpowerlowalarm_flag` etc. go?

> @mihirpat1 this PR removes several alarm flags, trying to understand if they are renamed or completed removed? E.g. where did `osnrhighalarm_flag`, `esnrlowalarm_flag`, `rxsigpowerlowalarm_flag` etc. go?

@infn-ke All these flags were moved to VDM related flag tables. Please refer to the below HLD for further details.

https://github.com/sonic-net/SONiC/blob/master/doc/platform_api/CMIS_Diagnostic_Monitoring_Overview_in_SONiC.md#3-state_db-schema-for-cmis-diagnostic-monitoring

Specifically, the VDM flags are now moved to TRANSCEIVER_VDM_HALARM_FLAG, TRANSCEIVER_VDM_LALARM_FLAG etc tables.

> Specifically, the VDM flags are now moved to TRANSCEIVER_VDM_HALARM_FLAG, TRANSCEIVER_VDM_LALARM_FLAG etc tables.

I see, does that mean they were duplicated in two apis earlier? So they would be in the `get_transceiver_vdm_flags` api now? And thanks for the reference!

> > Specifically, the VDM flags are now moved to TRANSCEIVER_VDM_HALARM_FLAG, TRANSCEIVER_VDM_LALARM_FLAG etc tables.
> 
> I see, does that mean they were duplicated in two apis earlier? So they would be in the `get_transceiver_vdm_flags` api now? And thanks for the reference!

@infn-ke Yes, that's correct.
Hi @mihirpat1 , please fix the conflict and create PR to 202505 branch

@prgeor Wondering if the current changeset requires special handling for SFF-8472 based transceivers since these transceivers have page select byte at byte 127, A2h instead of A0h.
/azp run
Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).

> @prgeor Wondering if the current changeset requires special handling for SFF-8472 based transceivers since these transceivers have page select byte at byte 127, A2h instead of A0h.

@mihirpat1 Good question. I think we should be good in that case because 0xA0 address space offset > 127 is a reserved space. We don't have a use case today

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/99acb3b7-26dd-4be8-9100-213b1ef97b2e)


In other words, all Access for offset > 127 will be in 0xA2 address space in SFP case.
/azp run
Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).
Why do you only need to reset the page code in 128-255 offset range? do you also need to reset the page code when offset is greater than 255?

> Why do you only need to reset the page code in 128-255 offset range? do you also need to reset the page code when offset is greater than 255?

@yxieca The optoe kernel driver before r/w to the page >=1 already sets the page selection register.
